meanings.definition: A cord or strap worn around the neck to hold a whistle, identification card, or other small object.
meanings.sent1: I wore a lanyard with my name tag to the conference.
meanings.sent2: She attached her keys to a lanyard for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The lanyard and whistle went on a little adventure together.
meanings.sent4: The lanyard of friendship connected them through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The bright red lanyard stood out in the sea of people.

meanings.definition: A short rope or cord used for fastening or securing something.
meanings.sent1: The lanyard held the boat securely to the dock.
meanings.sent2: He used a lanyard to tie up the bundle of sticks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel played tug-of-war with the lanyard.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a lanyard, binding her to his every command.
meanings.sent5: The lanyard wrapped around the tree like a protective hug.
